page.title: 15Wildlife in St John.
page.content: There are many different species of {birds}like robins, thrushes, blackbirds, magpies, sparrows and swallows. Sea birds and kestrels may be seen near the cliffs on the north coast. Varieties of{insects }include many kinds of butterflies, spiders, ants and beetles. Among the{amphibians}the Jersey "crapaud" (toad) can be found inhabiting the streams and ponds. {Trees, grasses, and plant-life} flourish and there are both deciduous and evergreen trees of all kinds. A great variety of{wild flowers}grow here along the hedgerows, in the uncultivated fields and along the coastal cliff grassland. One can sometimes see the occasional grass{snakes}or{slow worms.}
